concept_definition: used to ask about the identity of a person or people; which person or people (e.g., "Who is at the door?").
(pronoun) Used to ask for information about something or to request specification or identification (e.g., “What is your name?” “What did you say?”).
In or to what place; at or in which (used to ask about or refer to location).
at or during which time; at what time (used to ask about or refer to a time) — e.g., “When will you arrive?”
used to ask for a reason or explanation; for what cause or purpose (e.g., “Why did you leave?”).

In what way or manner; by what means. Used to ask about the manner, condition, or reason of something (e.g., “How did you do that?”) or to introduce clauses describing manner (e.g., “I know how to solve it”).
used to ask about one or more items from a defined set or to introduce a clause giving more information about a noun (e.g., "Which book do you want?"; "The house which Jack built").
used as an interrogative or relative pronoun to ask or indicate to whom something belongs (e.g., "Whose book is this?"; "the person whose car was stolen" )
(interrogative pronoun) Used to ask about the number or quantity of people or things (e.g., “How many apples are there?”).
object form of the pronoun 'who', used to refer to the person or people receiving an action or affected by it (e.g., "To whom did you give the book?").
